intro: Artrolobium tauricum, commonly known as the Tauric artrolobium, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
